title: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, April 11, 2014
description: One of the most pressing issues before attendees at the IMF spring meetings in Washington, D.C., doesn’t show up on the agenda – the situation in Ukraine. We offer a review of the tools and options bankers have. Plus: Some at the Fed are worried the inflation rate, around 1 percent, is too low. The hope is to nudge it up to 2 percent. What does the inflation rate tell us?  And why would we want to increase it?
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, April 11, 2014

byline: David Gura, Sally Herships, Steve Gardner, Stacey Vanek Smith and David Brancaccio
